intro: Octarrhena flava, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Octarrhena flava is often found growing on rocky soils or in sandy areas, showcasing its adaptability to challenging conditions.
